page.title: 11BENGEO GARDEN CENTRE, BENGEO
page.content: Since opening in 1976, the centre has grown from 2 sections (greengrocery & gardening) to include{ornamental fish, {butchers and general goods.}The garden section sells seeds, plants shrubs and sundries e.g. barbecues, garden gnomes and compost. Some produce is grown in {3 greenhouses, 10 polytunnels}and the nearby fields but most is bought in. The centre,open every day,is busiest at Christmas, selling decorations and trees. 23 are employed,14 part time. A man known as{Reg the Veg}drives around locally selling goods from a tractor. The{pick-your-own}fields first open in June for strawberries, gooseberries and rhubarb.People can pick as much as they like but some eat more than they weigh out! On Sundays{barbecued snacks are sold. Many locals use the centre and some customers travel miles to buy what they think is the best around.
